reviewText:
This is one of the real gems in an eight DVDs Time-Life collection of classic country music performances from Grand Ole Opry. This disc includes pioneering artists such as Roy Acuff, Eddy Arnold, Johnnie & Jack, George Morgan, Hank Snow and the Sons Of The Pioneers.  Grandpa Jones, who was already a relic when he appeared in this early '60s performance (and was about to find a whole new audience on "Hee Haw") rips into an explosive solo version of "Good Old Mountain Dew"; Carl Smith sings "Hey Joe"; Eddy Arnold gives a great version of "Cattle Call" and Louvin Brothers fans will delight to see them on a live, mid-1950s version of "I Don't Believe You've Met My Baby."

This disc includes fifteen live performances (and no lip-syncing, as far as I can tell...) along with bonus features such as interviews with various Opry veterans. The material is drawn from old Opry TV broadcasts and other venues such as "The Bobby Lord Show" and other, long-forgotten shows that were the country equivalents of "Soul Train" and "American Bandstand." The video quality is very good and the sound quality is excellent -- it's a chance to see many of the biggest stars in Nashville playing real, honest country music, the way it used to be.  This collection is a true gift -- highly recommended! (DJ Joe Sixpack / Slipcue music reviews)

This is a great collection of classic country artist videos. I was a little disappointed with how short it was overall . But the videos are really good and it is really fun to watch.
Mother and I love watching this! Great classic opry!
fun to see these early performances. The dvd arrived super fast. I found the sound and video quality to be very good.
Love this Dvd. I enjoy country music and these are the legends of country music. The selected songs were popular at that time and still are favorites of country music fans.

Neat video of Grand Ol' Opry Classics. One of a set, so there's a slight cut in the side of the case since it was bought outside of the set, but did not affect the disc at all. Great for any fan of early country music!

Reminds me of the "Good old days" Love to play it over and over again.
Sat and listened to it with friends.  One was a music teacher in a university

Love those old grand ole opry stars.  Great Video for country music lovers.
Bought it for my dad, he loved it.
Dvd's like this give youger people and the generation when the artist were big hits as a chance to see where these hits they may have heard came from and sang them first.
